ionet 0.2.2
  • Reference

Get data from the World Input-Output Database (WIOD)

Source: R/data_WIOD.R
data_WIOD.Rd

Download the WIOD data from ionet_ext, (an extension repository for storing data in the R package ionet), store it in the package directory, and load it into the R workspace. If the data has already been downloaded, a message will be displayed. If the data is downloaded but incomplete, an error message will be displayed.

Usage

data_WIOD(version = c("2013 release", "2016 release", "long run"), year)

Source

World Input-Output Database

Arguments

version

The specific version of WIOD, either "2013 release", "2016 release", or "long run".

year

The specific year of the data.

Value

The world input-output table of the WIOD specific version for the specific year.

Note

  • The size of the data may exceed the capacity of the internet connection, potentially limiting the download speed.

  • World input-output tables of the WIOD 2013 Release for the period from 1995 to 2011, covering 41 economies (27 EU economies, 13 other major economies, and the Rest of the World), each with 35 sectors. The format of the table is a data frame with 1443 rows and 1646 columns. Data are calculated in current prices. Values are denoted in millions of US dollars (USD).

  • World input-output tables of the WIOD 2016 Release for the period from 2000 to 2014, covering 44 economies (28 EU economies, 15 other major economies, and the Rest of the World), each with 56 sectors. The format of the table is a data frame with 2472 rows and 2690 columns. Data are calculated in current prices. Values are denoted in millions of US dollars (USD).

  • World input-output tables of the Long-run WIOD for the period from 1965 to 2000, covering 26 economies (25 economies, and the Rest of the World), each with 23 sectors. The format of the table is a data frame with 606 rows and 710 columns. Data are calculated in current prices. Values are denoted in millions of US dollars (USD).

References

  • Dietzenbacher, E., Los, B., Stehrer R., Timmer, M. P. and de Vries, G. J. (2013). "The Construction of World Input-Output Tables in the WIOD Project". Economic Systems Research, 25(1), 71--98.

  • Timmer, M. P., Dietzenbacher, E., Los, B., Stehrer, R. and de Vries, G. J. (2015). "An Illustrated User Guide to the World Input-Output Database: the Case of Global Automotive Production". Review of International Economics, 23(3), 575--605.

  • Timmer, M. P., Los, B., Stehrer, R. and de Vries, G. J. (2016). "An Anatomy of the Global Trade Slowdown based on the WIOD 2016 Release". GGDC Research Memorandum 162, University of Groningen.

  • Woltjer, P., Gouma, R. and Timmer, M. P. (2021). "Long-run World Input-Output Database: Version 1.1 Sources and Methods". GGDC Research Memorandum 190, University of Groningen.
